questiontext.text:
Third quadrant \( (180^\circ\le \theta\le 270^\circ) \)

The figure below shows how \(\cos \theta\) and \(\sin \theta\) change as \(\theta\) moves in the third quadrant.

\(\theta = 180^\circ\) so \(\cos \theta = -1\) and \(\sin \theta = 0\).

\(180^\circ <\theta < 270^\circ\), then \(\cos \theta = OQ\) (negative) and \(\sin \theta = OR\) (negative)

\(\theta = 270^\circ\)
